meta.title: Basic pagetree
meta.description: This is the basic pagetree of the kd_base distribution. It contains a structure to follow for menus and a tutorial on how to install and extend the distribution for easy site creation.

rec.title: First download the extension from here:

The second way if to use the Extension M...

fieldlist.field: This is the root template for the site. It includes all necessary templates to have the page be rendered.

This base distribution provides you with a basic page structure and a working template out of the box. You just need to extend this extension with your own site package and add your templates and resources.

This distribution provides a little tutorial on how to do this right. It should be easy to follow and you will get a future proof TYPO3 site as a result.

So please follow the tutorial if you haven't done so already.

I wish you happy coding with your new TYPO3 site ;)

This is the root template of this website. All TypoScript is incuded by Extensions. Please do not include any TypoScript into this Template because it is good practive to place TypoScript in files, so a VCS, such as GIT, can cover it.

The system you are seeing right now has been build by me, because I wanted to provide a basic configuration for my TYPO3 projects. The idea behind this is, that 90% of installations use the exact same configuration schema and to do these configurations every time from scratch for every new TYPO3 instance is unnecessary time waste. There are other base distributions out there, but every one does things slightly different. This does not have to be a bad thing at all, but the building of this distribution has been a very nice source of self education for me. I decided to create a whole tutorial withing this distribution to describe what has been done and to help you and others to build their own TYPO3 templates and sites.

Without further adue, read on to learn how to install this package or go to Usage to learn how to configure the distribution to your liking and check out the References section to checkout all the options you might want to use.

This base distribution has been build to work with composer. It can be downloaded from its packagist or github page either via composer or as a ZIP to import into the TYPO3 extension manager.

For either method, you need TYPO3 8.7LTS installed on a web server of your liking. To get to know what prerequisits you must fit for TYPO3 you can visit the TYPO3 download page or take a look into the INSTALL.md file of the TYPO3 source.

Since TYPO3 7 there is the possibility to install TYPO3 via composer. If you want to learn more about that, please visit the TYPO3 Wiki for more information.
To install this package via composer, you just need to add the requirement to the-coding-owl/kd-base to your composer.json file of your project. You can achieve this with the following command:

composer require the-coding-owl/kd-base

The composer package manager will then add the package to the composer.json and check the necessarry dependencies that needs to be added for the package to work.

To enable the package in your TYPO3 installation, just call your TYPO3 CLI script to enable the extension like so:

bin/typo3cms extension:activate kd_base
bin/typo3cms cache:flush

The extension will install this page tree as a starting point for you to follow along.

To update the extension do:

composer update the-coding-owl/kd-base

and repeat the extension setup via:

bin/typo3cms extension:setup kd_base
bin/typo3cms cache:flush

The TYPO3 ExtensionManager exists for a long time now and can still be used to install extensions. Since this package is designed to work with composer, you can not simply download it from the TER (TYPO3 Extension Repository). The decision to not include this or any other of my extensions in the TER has been done because the composer repository, formaly known as packagist.org, is the better place to have those extensions hosted and managed. On packagist there not only can the extensions themselfes be hosted, but their dependencies to external libraries are most likely located there, as well. So when hosting an extension on TER, an extension developer has to include external libraries into the extension, where the extension hosted on packagist does not need to include the whole library, but simply a dependency to the library package on packagist and composer will build the code needed. This is a much more clean and better way to manage extensions in the future and is the prefered way of building future TYPO3 extensions.

However, it is still possible to install this package as a TYPO3 extension without the need of composer at all, because the extension can be downloaded as a ZIP file from its github repository page, and simply be imported into the extension manager, which will install the extension without any problems the old way. There is a downside of this method however, that you can not update the extension so easily, because it is not part of the TYPO3 TER and the Extension Manager can not notify you about updates at this point.
First download the extension from here:

Now there are two different ways how to install the extension, upload the ZIP and unpack the extension on the server or upload it via the Extension Manager.

When you upload the ZIP to the server yourself, you can unpack the contents into the typo3conf/ext folder and rename the unpacked folder into kd_base. The Extension Manager will show the extension in its list of uninstalled extensions aftwards and you can simply install it via a click on the install button.

The second way if to use the Extension Manager to upload and install the extension all at once. Unfortunately, the ZIP from github is't created in a way the Extension Manager understands, so we need to unpack the ZIP and pack up the insides of the resulting folder again.

So simply unpack the ZIP onto your hard drive, hop into the folder kd_base-master and pack up all files in this folder into a new ZIP. Then visit the Extension Manager in your backend and klick on the import icon on the top left corner of the extension list. In the resulting upload form, select your newly created ZIP and click the upload button. The Extension Manager will upload and install the extension automatically.

Congratulations, you installed the kd_base package successfully and can start with customizing your page. Please go on with the Usage section of this tutorial to get to know how to extend this basic distribution the right and easy way.
